user_request.sanitized: Create a GUI app (pure Rust + QML + CxxQt) to house a terminal that can be spawned on the host machine from container and have that provide approve/decline options. Decline could ask for a reason which it could send back to the MCP which could then provide back to the agent.

requirements: Standalone Rust+QML GUI application using CxxQt
Terminal widget showing pending command for approval
Approve button that executes command and streams output
Decline button with text field for reason capture
TCP loopback server listening for MCP server connections
Graceful shutdown on session end or timeout
constraints: Must use CxxQt for Rust+QML integration
Pre-installed binary on host machine (not bundled in container)
Must handle: approve, decline (with reason), timeout
App auto-exits when session closes or heartbeat lost

additional_notes.sanitized: This is Plan 1 of the 'Interactive Terminal GUI System' program. The GUI app must be built first as Plans 2-4 depend on it. Reference repo: https://github.com/ttommyth/interactive-mcp (uses file-based IPC + Ink CLI â€” we are doing native GUI + TCP instead). CxxQt skill file exists at .github/skills/cxxqt-rust-gui/SKILL.md. The app directory should be created at the workspace root level (e.g., interactive-terminal/ or gui-terminal/).
